newsitem.title: USA: Late NYMEX Hub natgas mostly holds gains with cash.
newsitem.headline: Late NYMEX Hub natgas mostly holds gains with cash.

text.p: Most NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures held modest gains late Wednesday in sluggish activity, with reports of firmer physical prices lifting the fronts though the market remained stuck in a technical range.
At 1430 EDT, July was still up by 1.7 cents at $2.176 per million British thermal units, while August was 2.5 cents higher at $2.195. Others remained mixed, with some 1998s down.
"We've been stuck in a range for a while, but the weather next week is slightly constructive and it gives me reason to think there's a little room to the upside," said one Texas-based trader.

He said some forecasters were now looking for warmer temperatures next week in eastern and southern states, a factor that should support the cash ahead of bidweek late next week, particularly if the West stays hot.
But he said he expected July to run out of steam in the mid-$2.20s without a broader, more sustained heat wave.
A Reuter poll showed most expected an 85-95 bcf weekly stock build when the AGA report is released later today. For the same week last year, stocks rose by 87 bcf.
Technically, traders still saw July resistance at $2.21, $2.25 and $2.37. Support remained at $2.055 and $2.

In the cash, Louisiana Gulf Coast gas firmed Wednesday by two to three cents to about the $2.20 area. Midcon pipes were talked up slightly at about $2.05. New York city gate gas sold at $2.45, also about two cents higher.
NYMEX said 8,144 contracts traded at 1115 EDT.
On the KCBT, July climbed three cents to $2.05, while deferreds were steady to 2.5 cents higher. The East/West spread narrowed by 1.3 cents to 12.6 cents (NYMEX premium).
